# function: repeat

Return a list or string that repeats the input list or string the specified number of times.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Return the list repeated twice:
provider::stdlib::repeat(["zero", "one", "two"], 2)
# result => ["zero", "one", "two", "zero", "one", "two"]

# Return the string repeated twice:
provider::stdlib::repeat("pizza", 2)
# result => "pizzapizza"

# Return the list repeated zero times (empty):
provider::stdlib::repeat(["zero", "one", "two"], 0)
# result => []

# Return the string repeated zero times (empty):
provider::stdlib::repeat("pizza", 0)
# result => ""
```

## Signature

<!-- signature generated by tfplugindocs -->
```text
repeat(repeater dynamic, count number) dynamic
```

## Arguments

<!-- arguments generated by tfplugindocs -->
1. `repeater` (Dynamic) Input list or string parameter for repeating. The list or string must contain at least one element.
1. `count` (Number) Number of times to repeat the input list or string. This cannot be a negative number.
